header_summary:
In recent discussions, the sender explores the penalty of the actuary and the linear dependence of total fidelity bond on the number of participants in PathCoin. They propose a mechanism involving CTV/covenant and fixed order transfers to address this issue. The sender also discusses the exploration of alternative ideas, stability of the fixed-path approach, and the potential role of APO in solving the problem.

Another topic discussed is the importance of designing a good API, even for toy examples or non-important use cases. The sender highlights flaws in certain approaches and suggests designs for a vault using BIP 345 and an alternative approach using BIP 119's CTV. Oracles and discreet log contracts are briefly mentioned as well.

Focus shifts to consensus changes and the sender argues against designing APIs without considering important use cases. They propose a vault design using BIP 345 and a solution using BIP 119's CTV to address flaws related to fund theft. Oracles, discreet log contracts, and making on-chain contracts using adaptor signatures are briefly touched upon.

Bitcoin Core v25.1 with full-rbf peering code and additional updates is announced in another email. The sender encourages more people to run this version, provides information on hash power and mining pools using full-RBF, and offers links for further details.

Research on HTLC output aggregation as a solution to transaction recycling, jamming, and on-chain efficiency issues is shared. The sender explains the process of collapsing HTLC outputs into a single one and proposes the need for a new covenant primitive on Layer 1. Various inspection methods and a proof-of-concept demo are mentioned, with a note that it is still experimental.

recent_posts.summary:

- Each sentence should be no more than fifteen words and start with a hyphen.
- The summary should adhere to proper grammar, maintain a formal tone, and avoid context phrases.

recent_posts.title: Full-RBF Peering Bitcoin Core v25.1 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v25.1, with full-rbf peering code by Antoine Riard, is now on GitHub.
- This version promotes the use of full-rbf by advertising and connecting to more peers.
- Full-rbf is preferred by 31% of hash power and 4 mining pools, explained in detail at https://petertodd.org/2023/why-you-should-run-mempoolfullrbf.

recent_posts.title: Fwd: HTLC output aggregation as a mitigation for tx recycling, jamming, and on-chain efficiency (covenants)
recent_posts.summary:
- Johan Torås Halseth shares research on HTLC output aggregation as a solution for transaction recycling, jamming, and efficiency issues.
- HTLC output aggregation allows collapsing all HTLC outputs into one, reducing commitment size and allowing fee control.
- Implementing this approach requires a new covenant primitive on Layer 1 and raises questions about PTLCs.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
active_posts.summary:
- A new transaction-relay jamming attack called replacement cycling was discovered in December 2022, posing a risk to lightning channels.
- Major lightning implementations, including LDK v0.0.118, Eclair v0.9.0, LND v0.17.0-beta, and Core-Lightning v23.08.01, have implemented mitigations.
- Bitcoin applications using bitcoin script timelocks or multi-party transactions may also be affected by denial-of-service vectors.

active_posts.title: Proposed BIP for OP_CAT
active_posts.summary:
- A draft BIP proposes enabling OP_CAT as a Tapscript opcode with a maximum stack element size.
- OP_CAT allows concatenation of stack values, expanding the functionality of Tapscript.
- Use cases include multisignature scripts, logical spend conditions, and protecting compromised outputs.

active_posts.title: Full Disclosure: CVE-2023-40231 / CVE-2023-40232 / CVE-2023-40233 / CVE-2023-40234 "All your mempool are belong to us"
active_posts.summary:
- A new transaction-relay jamming attack poses a risk to lightning channels' funds safety.
- Lightning channels are the main target, but other bitcoin applications could also be affected.
- Mitigations have been proposed, but further research and development are needed in this area.

active_posts.title: Proposed BIP for OP_CAT
active_posts.summary:
- A draft BIP proposes enabling the OP_CAT opcode in Tapscript, overcoming previous concerns.
- OP_CAT concatenates two values on the stack, increasing the functionality of Tapscript.
- Tree signatures, Lamport Signatures, vaults, and more can benefit from OP_CAT in Bitcoin transactions.

active_posts.title: Ordinals BIP PR
